div.p: Royal Geographical Society of Australasia (Victorian Branch), box 52(d), Royal Historical Society of Victoria, Melbourne.

The letter is embossed with a maroon letterhead of the Government of Tasmania. The letter is bound in with the minutes of the meeting of the Council of the Branch held on 23 March 1892. 7th April 1892

I beg that you will convey to the Victorian Branch of the Geographical Society of Australasia my best thanks for the honorary membership of their Society which they have conferred upon me, and assure them that it will at all times be a great pleasure and satisfaction to me if I can in any way forward their objects and interests.

I thank you for the kind terms of your letter conveying the diploma,
Letter not found. and beg you to believe that my pleasure in receiving it is greatly enhanced by the circumstance that it should have been granted during the presidency of so distinguished a man of science as yourself.
